009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.line;
010
011import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.Array2DRowRealMatrix;
012import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.QRDecomposition;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularValueDecomposition;
016
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.line.AlgebraicLine;
020import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
021
022/**
023 * Line fit by solving a homogeneous system, as described in
024 * Gander, Gander, Kwok: "Scientific Computing", Springer 2014 (Sec. 6.7.1).
025 * @author WB
026 *
027 */
028public class OrthogonalLineFitHomogeneous implements LineFit {
029        
030        public static boolean VERBOSE = false;
031        
032        private final Pnt2d[] points;
033        private final double[] p;       // line parameters A,B,C
034        
035        public OrthogonalLineFitHomogeneous(Pnt2d[] points) {
036                if (points.length < 2) {
037                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("line fit requires at least 2 points");
038                }
039                this.points = points;
040                this.p = fit();
041        }
042        
043        @Override
044        public int getSize() {
045                return points.length;
046        }
047        
048//      @Override
049//      public Pnt2d[] getPoints() {
050//              return points;
051//      }
052
053        @Override
054        public double[] getLineParameters() {
055                return p;
056        }
057        
058        private double[] fit() {
059                final int n = points.length; //.max(3, pts.length);
060                final double[][] X = new double[n][3];
061                
062                for (int i = 0; i < points.length; i++) {
063                        X[i][0] = 1;
064                        X[i][1] = points[i].getX();
065                        X[i][2] = points[i].getY();
066                }
067                
068//              System.out.println("X = \n" + Matrix.toString(X));
069                
070                QRDecomposition qr = new QRDecomposition(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(X));
071//              RealMatrix Q = qr.getQ();
072                RealMatrix R = qr.getR();
073//              System.out.println("Q = \n" + Matrix.toString(Q));
074//              System.out.println("R = \n" + Matrix.toString(R));
075                
076//              RealMatrix RR = R.getSubMatrix(1, 2, 1, 2);
077                RealMatrix RR = new Array2DRowRealMatrix(2,2);
078                RR.setEntry(0, 0, R.getEntry(1, 1));
079                RR.setEntry(0, 1, R.getEntry(1, 2));
080                if (R.getRowDimension() >= 3) {
081                        RR.setEntry(1, 1, R.getEntry(2, 2));
082                }
083                
084//              System.out.println("RR = \n" + Matrix.toString(RR));
085        
086                SingularValueDecomposition svd = new SingularValueDecomposition(RR);
087                
088                RealMatrix V = svd.getV();
089//              System.out.println("V = \n" + Matrix.toString(V));
090                double[] s = svd.getSingularValues();
091                int k = Matrix.idxMin(s);
092                double[] e = V.getColumn(k);
093                
094                double R01 = R.getEntry(0, 1);
095                double R02 = R.getEntry(0, 2);
096                double R00 = R.getEntry(0, 0);
097
098                double A = e[0];
099                double B = e[1];
100                double C = ( -A * R01 - B * R02) / R00;
101                return new double[] {A,B,C};
102        }
103        
104
105        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
106        
107//      static double[][] X = {{ 10, 6 }, { 4, 3 }, { 18, 2 }, { 7, 1 }, { 5, 6 }};
108//      static double[][] X = {{ 10, 6 }, { 4, 3 }};
109//      static double[][] X = {{ 1, 1 }, { 3, 3 },  { 13, 13 }};
110        static double[][] X = {{1, 8}, {4, 5}, {4, 7}, {6, 4}, {9, 4}}; // book example
111        
112        public static void main(String[] args) {
113                VERBOSE = true;
114                Pnt2d[] pts = PntUtils.fromDoubleArray(X);
115                OrthogonalLineFitHomogeneous fit = new OrthogonalLineFitHomogeneous(pts);
116                System.out.println(fit.getClass());
117                AlgebraicLine line = fit.getLine();
118                System.out.println("line = " + line);
119                System.out.println("avg error = " + fit.getSquaredOrthogonalError(pts) / X.length);
120        }
121        
122//      line = AlgebraicLine <a=-0.497, b=-0.868, c=7.245>
123//      avg error = 0.532916687009732
124        
125}
